name: Tuan, Bertrand
employer: Pacific Hematology-Oncology Associates / Sutter Health (California Pacific Medical Center)
title: Physician - Hematologist/Oncologist
notes: Dr. Bertrand Y. Tuan, MD is a hematologist-oncologist with over 40 years of experience in San Francisco, California. He received his MD from Albert Einstein College of Medicine, completed residency in internal medicine at Boston City Hospital, and a fellowship in hematology-oncology at Massachusetts General Hospital. He is affiliated with California Pacific Medical Center and Novato Community Hospital, and participates in clinical trials.

name: Vaughan, Richard Haylest
title: Music Director / Cellist
notes: Richard Vaughan served as music director and teacher at Hillview Middle School in Menlo Park, California for 23 years (2001-2024), retiring in spring 2024. A National Board certified music educator and cellist, he performed internationally in chamber music festivals and as a soloist. He grew up in Portola Valley and attended Menlo School. Prior to Hillview, he served as music director at Woodside School and as Assistant Conductor with the El Camino Youth Symphony (1997-2001).

name: Walters, Frank L. Jr.
title: Managing Director, Capital Markets
notes: Frank Walters joined Silver Lake in 2013 and serves as Managing Director on the Capital Markets team, based in San Francisco. Previously he was a Senior Operations Analyst at Workday, an Associate at Kelso & Company (private equity), and an Investment Banking Analyst at Lehman Brothers in the Financial Sponsors Group. He holds an M.B.A. from Columbia Business School and a B.A. from Princeton University.

name: Agius, Tancred E. A.
notes: Born March 11, 1939 in Moseley, Surrey, England. Worked for M&M Mars and in marketing for Rueben H. Donnelly; moved to US in 1978, working in Philadelphia and New York. Brother of Marcus Agius (former Barclays chairman). Passed away February 14, 2026 in Walnut Creek, CA.

name: Fridell, Squire
title: Co-owner and Winemaker
notes: American retired actor born February 9, 1943 in Oakland, CA. Performed in over 3,250 television commercials; served concurrently as spokesman for Toyota (1978-2012) and McDonald's (portraying Ronald McDonald 1985-1991). Holds a master's degree in acting/directing and taught professionally for over 30 years. Co-founded GlenLyon Vineyards (26 acres) with wife Suzanne in Glen Ellen, Sonoma Valley in 1986.

name: Grady, Mark F.
title: Distinguished Professor of Law Emeritus
ngos: American Law and Economics Association (founding trustee)
notes: Law professor and legal scholar specializing in law and economics, torts, antitrust, and intellectual property. A.B. in Economics and J.D. both from UCLA. On UCLA faculty since 1992; Director of UCLA Center for Law and Economics since 2004. Previously Dean of George Mason University School of Law (1997-2004), where he raised the school's national ranking from 75th to 38th. Served as consultant to President Ronald Reagan; presented policy papers at Clinton White House; lecturer to federal judges.

name: Gruber, Wyatt
title: President and Managing Member
ngos: Tipping Point Community (Chair, Leadership Council); Cate School (Chair)
notes: San Francisco-based hedge fund manager. Previously at Arience Capital, RS Investments, and Robertson Stephens. Duke University graduate with MBA from MIT Sloan School of Management. Ross Creek Capital Management LLC founded 2010, based at 100 Pine Street, San Francisco.

name: Hazen, Paul
title: Chairman
donations: Member of the Democratic Party; specific federal FEC contribution records not located in public search.
ngos: San Francisco Symphony (former board member); San Francisco Museum of Modern Art (former board member)
notes: Born November 29, 1941. B.S. finance, University of Arizona (1963); MBA, Haas School of Business, UC Berkeley (1964). Joined Wells Fargo in 1970; served as President and COO 1984-1995; Chairman and CEO 1995-2001. Elected Chairman of Accel-KKR and KKR Financial Holding Corporation in July 2004. Served on Federal Advisory Council to the Federal Reserve 1987-1991, serving as President 1991 reporting to Alan Greenspan. Past board positions include Safeway (Lead Independent Director), KKR Financial Holding (Chairman), Phelps Dodge, Vodafone Group (Deputy Chairman and Lead Independent Director), Willis Group Holdings, Xstrata, Blackhawk Network Holdings, KSL Resorts. Senior Advisor at KSL Capital Partners.

name: Long, Darrell D. E.
title: Distinguished Professor Emeritus of Engineering
notes: Computer scientist and engineer. Inaugural holder of the Kumar Malavalli Endowed Chair of Storage Systems Research at UC Santa Cruz. Director Emeritus of the NSF I/UCRC Center for Research in Storage Systems and Storage Systems Research Center. B.S. Computer Science from San Diego State University; M.S. and Ph.D. from UC San Diego. Fellow of IEEE and Fellow of AAAS. Since 2002, member of JASON, the independent group of elite scientists advising the U.S. government on national security matters. Served on advisory panels for the National Research Council, Department of Energy, Department of Defense, and the Intelligence Community. The Ceph distributed file system was first designed in his lab (2006).

name: Marshall, Christopher P.
title: General Partner and Co-CEO
notes: Joined TCV in 2008; named Co-CEO alongside Jon Reynolds Jr. Focuses on fintech, internet, and digital media & entertainment investments. Named to Forbes Midas List as top technology investor. Current board positions include Spotify (lead independent director), Built, GoFundMe, Nerdy (NYSE: NRDY), Newsela, Payoneer (NASDAQ: PAYO), and Sojern.

name: Michelson, Michael W.
title: Member, Private Equity
notes: Joined KKR in 1981; General Partner of KKR Associates LP since January 1987. Previously Co-Head of Americas Private Equity and Co-Head of North American Private Equity. Also served as Chairman of KKR's Inclusion & Diversity Council and Head of Health Care Industry Team. A.B., cum laude, Phi Beta Kappa, Harvard College (1973); J.D., cum laude, Harvard Law School (1976). Began career at Latham & Watkins LLP in Los Angeles specializing in management buyouts. Current board positions include Mills Fleet Farm and Zimmer Biomet Holdings (independent director since 2015).

name: Nees, John Morgan
title: Founding Partner
ngos: Winrock International (Board of Directors, 2015); As You Sow (advisory board)
notes: B.S. Geological Engineering, Purdue University; MBA, Emory University; J.D., University of San Francisco School of Law. Active California Bar member. Co-founder of PlumpJack Winery in Napa Valley (since 1995). Currently developing Kukio Golf & Beach Club residential resort on Hawaii's Big Island. International business experience spanning Russia, Venezuela, India, Indonesia, and Africa in energy and eco-tourism ventures.

name: Orrick, Murray Scott
notes: Likely connected to the Orrick family of San Francisco, associated with the law firm Orrick, Herrington & Sutcliffe (founded 1863). The Orrick family includes Judge William H. Orrick Jr. (1915-2003), U.S. District Judge for the Northern District of California, and William Orrick III, current senior U.S. District Judge for the Northern District of California.

name: Podell, Nick
title: Founder and President
donations: Active in San Francisco local politics through Neighbors for a Better San Francisco Advocacy (501(c)(4)); donations at $10,000-$200,000 level to local SF political causes. Federal FEC records not specifically identified.
ngos: San Francisco Zoological Society (past Chairman)
notes: San Francisco-based real estate developer. Founded Nick Podell Company in 2004; previously 20 years with family firm M.H. Podell Company. Has built nearly 2,600 apartment units in San Francisco, Santa Clara and Alameda Counties. Licensed California General Contractor. B.A. from Middlebury College. President of Neighbors for a Better San Francisco Advocacy. In 2026 facing San Francisco city subpoena over alleged failure to fulfill $500K pledge made in 2016 for Mission District housing deal.

name: Priske, Joseph L.
title: Principal
notes: Real estate developer with business connections in Texas (Houston, Austin) and California. Associated with approximately 28 companies formed over 36 years. Priske Development Inc. was incorporated in California in 1981 but is no longer active; current operations based in Houston, TX.

name: Raether, Paul E.
title: Senior Advisory Partner
ngos: Trinity College, Hartford CT (former Board Chairman, served 25 years, last 12 as chairman, retired 2014); Tuck School of Business at Dartmouth College (Trustee, Board of Overseers); U.S. Ski and Snowboard Foundation (Trustee); Institute for Sports Medicine Research, New York (President)
notes: Joined KKR in 1980; became Partner in 1986; promoted to Senior Advisory Partner in 2018. Served as Head of the Portfolio Management Committee for 10 years. Prior to KKR: U.S. Navy officer; then corporate finance at Reynolds Securities and Blyth Eastman Dillon & Company. B.A. from Trinity College; MBA from Tuck School of Business at Dartmouth College. Notable portfolio company involvement includes RJR Nabisco, Duracell, Fleet/Bank of New England, and Shoppers Drug Mart. Current board positions include Apple Leisure Group and BrightView (Chairman of the Board). Named Honorary Chairperson of the Michael Lynch Memorial Foundation dinner.

name: Roberts, George R.
title: Co-Founder and Co-Executive Chairman
donations: Republican donor. $64,543 in 2020 cycle. Donated to Perdue for Senate ($5,600), Cornyn for Senate ($5,600), Trump Victory (~$10,204), Collins for Senate, Hagerty for Senate; minor D: $1,103.

name: Sickel, Edward T. IV
title: Financial Advisor
notes: Registered investment adviser (CRD# 423217) based in Palo Alto, CA (East Palo Alto office). Over 40 years of experience in the finance industry. Holds securities registrations S1, S12, S40, S63, and S65. No public disclosures on FINRA BrokerCheck. Full name: Edward Theodore Sickel IV.

name: Stepan, John A.
notes: Likely connected to the Stepan family of Northbrook, Illinois, founders of Stepan Company (NYSE: SCL), a specialty chemicals manufacturer founded in 1932. The Stepan family includes founder Alfred C. Stepan Jr. and multiple descendants including F. Quinn Stepan (chairman 1984-2005) and F. Quinn Stepan Jr. (current chairman). A 'John' is referenced among the brothers of political scientist Alfred Stepan.

name: de Laszlo, Damon
title: Chairman
ngos: Economic Research Council, London (Chairman since 1981); Bradshaw Foundation (co-founder and Chairman); Shivia (Ambassador); TCW Group / Trust Company of West (board of directors)
notes: Born October 8, 1942 in London. British economist and electronics industry executive. Educated at Gordonstoun School (Scotland) and Rosenberg College (Switzerland). Commissioned second lieutenant in British Army 1962, retiring as captain in 1970. Chairman of Harwin plc, which designs and manufactures electronic connectors and components. Fellow of the Royal Society of Arts. Awarded CBE (Commander of the Order of the British Empire) in the 2025 King's Birthday Honours for services to manufacturing industry and to scientific and charitable causes. Has served on boards of companies in Europe and the United States including TCW Group in California (from 1980). The de Laszlo Foundation (founded 1987) advances education and research in arts, science, economics and medicine.

name: Armstrong, David A.
title: Unknown
notes: No distinct public profile found for David A. Armstrong as a Bohemian Grove-Wayside Log member. Multiple people with this name exist in law, theater, and technology, but no definitive match was found.

name: Avlon, John P.
title: Senior Political Analyst and Anchor (former); 2024 Democratic Congressional Candidate, NY-1
donations: 2024 Democratic congressional candidate, NY-1 (lost to Republican Nick LaLota)
ngos: Co-founder (2010), No Labels (501(c)(4) bipartisan political group); left No Labels in 2013
notes: John Avlon served as CNN's senior political analyst and anchor from 2018 to 2024 and previously as editor-in-chief of The Daily Beast (2013-2018). He began as a speechwriter for Mayor Rudy Giuliani. In 2024 he ran unsuccessfully for Congress in New York's 1st District. He is married to Margaret Hoover.

name: Balletto, John G.
title: Founder and Owner
ngos: Donated 4 acres to Sonoma County Open Space District; donated land for farmworker baseball field
notes: John Balletto took over his family's five-acre farm at age 17 in 1977 and built it into the largest vegetable farm in Northern California (700 acres, 70 vegetable varieties). After three successive El Nino crop failures in 1998, he transitioned to wine grapes, releasing the first Balletto Vineyards vintage in 2001. Today the estate encompasses 600 acres in Russian River Valley.

name: Brinkley, Douglas
title: Katherine Tsanoff Brown Chair in Humanities; Professor of History; CNN Presidential Historian
ngos: Trustee, Theodore Roosevelt Presidential Library Foundation; Trustee, Madison Council at the Library of Congress; Trustee, National Archives Foundation; Trustee, Bruce Springsteen Archives; Trustee, Woody Guthrie Center; Trustee, Bob Dylan Center
notes: Douglas Brinkley (born December 14, 1960) joined Rice University in 2007 and serves as CNN's presidential historian. He has written over 20 books, with six named NYT Notable Books of the Year and seven becoming NYT bestsellers. He received a Grammy Award for Presidential Suite and seven honorary doctorates.

name: Buffett, Jimmy
title: Musician, Songwriter, Businessman
notes: Jimmy Buffett (December 25, 1946 - September 1, 2023) was one of the most commercially successful singer-songwriters in American history, best known for 'Margaritaville' (1977). He sold over 20 million records across 29 studio albums and built the Margaritaville brand into a hospitality and consumer products empire. Posthumously inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2024.

name: Butcher, Preston
employer: Legacy Partners (formerly Lincoln Property Company N.C., Inc.)
title: Chairman
ngos: Co-founder and past Chairman, National Multi Housing Council; Co-founder and Director, California Housing Council; Founding board member, BRIDGE Housing (nonprofit); Policy Advisory Board, Fisher Center for Real Estate at UC Berkeley; past Overseer, Hoover Institution Stanford; past Trustee, Urban Land Institute (ULI)
notes: C. Preston Butcher (born 1939) earned a BS in Electrical Engineering from University of Texas (1962) and built Lincoln Property Company's Western Region into one of the largest residential real estate operations in the U.S. He founded Legacy Partners in 1998 by buying the Western division, developing over 78,000 housing units exceeding $8 billion in cost.

name: Campbell, Blake
title: Unknown
notes: No distinct public profile found for Blake Campbell as a Bohemian Grove-Wayside Log member. Multiple executives with this name exist but no definitive match was identified.

name: Cay, John E. III
employer: Cay Insurance; formerly Wells Fargo Insurance Services (Vice Chairman)
title: Chairman; formerly Vice Chairman
ngos: Board Chair, Director or Member of more than 30 non-profit organizations over his career; Girl Scouts of the USA Honorary Trustee
notes: John Eugene Cay III (UNC-Chapel Hill 1968) succeeded his father as President and CEO of Palmer & Cay at age 27, growing it into one of the largest privately held insurance brokerage firms in the U.S. In 2005, Palmer & Cay merged with Wachovia (later Wells Fargo) Insurance Services. He has over 40 years of executive insurance leadership.

name: Church, Eric
title: Country Music Singer/Songwriter
donations: No FEC records found; known as politically independent; critical of the NRA after 2017 Las Vegas shooting
notes: Kenneth Eric Church (born May 3, 1977, Granite Falls, NC) is a Grammy-nominated country music star whose 2011 album Chief debuted at #1 on both country and Billboard 200 charts. He won the CMA Entertainer of the Year in 2020 and is known for his signature aviator sunglasses. His eighth studio album, Evangeline vs. the Machine, was released May 2025.

name: Colman, Robert S.
title: Unknown
notes: No distinct public profile found for Robert S. Colman as a Bohemian Grove-Wayside Log member.

name: Cummins, Donal Casey
title: Principal Attorney (Family Law)
notes: Donal Casey Cummins earned his BA in Business Administration from Gonzaga University and his JD from University of San Francisco School of Law (1970). He founded the Law Offices of Cummins & Holmes in San Ramon, California in 1971, specializing in family law. He has served as a Judge Pro Tem in Contra Costa County Superior Court.

name: Dennis, Harry L. E.
title: Unknown
notes: No distinct public profile found for Harry L.E. Dennis as a Bohemian Grove-Wayside Log member. L. Franklyn Elliott (see separate entry) is a plastic surgeon in Atlanta, not necessarily the same.

name: Duboc, Robert M. Jr.
title: Unknown
notes: Robert M. Duboc Jr. has filed patents in display technology and spatial light modulators. His father Robert Duboc (1927-2023) was a Kansas City attorney who graduated from University of Kansas and Michigan Law School. No confirmed employer or title found for the Bohemian Grove member.

name: Dutra, Randal M.
title: Painter, Sculptor, and Visual Effects Artist
notes: Randal M. Dutra (born 1958, California) works in impressionism/realism in painting and sculpture. He began his film career as a creature technician on Return of the Jedi (1983) and received two Academy Award nominations for visual effects on Jurassic Park II: The Lost World and War of the Worlds. He is a member of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.

name: Edelman, David
employer: MIT Internet Policy Research Initiative; Anzu Partners
title: Director, Project on Technology Economy and National Security; Partner
ngos: Brookings Institution (senior fellow); MIT CSAIL and Center for International Studies
notes: R. David Edelman served as Special Assistant to the President for Economic and Technology Policy at the White House National Economic Council (2011-2017), co-authoring the nation's first International Strategy for Cyberspace and first AI policy. He holds a BA from Yale and MA/DPhil from Oxford (Clarendon Scholar).

name: Elliott, L. Franklyn
employer: Atlanta Plastic Surgery, PC; Northside Hospital
title: Plastic and Reconstructive Surgeon
notes: L. Franklyn Elliott, MD has been board-certified by the American Board of Plastic Surgery since 1984. He is world-renowned for contributions to cosmetic and reconstructive surgery, including advances in breast reconstruction and the TRAM flap method. He served as Program Chairman of the Breast Surgery Symposium in Atlanta from 1988 to 2004.

name: Eng, Kevin K.
title: Unknown
notes: No distinct public profile found for Kevin K. Eng as a Bohemian Grove-Wayside Log member. A Kevin D. Eng (different middle initial) is CEO/CIO of Columbus Hill Capital Management, but it is uncertain if this is the same person.

name: Feld, Alan D.
employer: Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP
title: Senior Executive Partner
ngos: SMU Trustee Emeritus (one of only 11 in university history); SMU Law School Professorship named in his honor
notes: Alan D. Feld joined Akin Gump in 1960 and is one of four Senior Executive Partners at the firm, which bears his name. He has more than 60 years of experience in corporate finance and securities law. In 1985, he was appointed by the Texas Governor to the Texas State Securities Board, serving as Chairman through 1991. He received the 2018 Texas Lawyer Lifetime Achievement Award.

name: Gilligan, Patrick
title: President and Chief Executive Officer (as of June 2025)
ngos: Board member, The Blue Venture Fund; Cobalt Benefits Group
notes: Patrick Gilligan (Holy Cross BA, Mathematics, 1986) has over 25 years in health plan leadership. He previously served as Chief Commercial Officer at Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts and held senior positions at CVS Health and Partners HealthCare before becoming CEO of Point32Health (formerly BCBS Massachusetts) in June 2025.

name: Harrison, Walter F. III
title: Unknown
notes: No distinct public profile found for Walter F. Harrison III as a Bohemian Grove-Wayside Log member. Walter Harrison is also the name of the former President of the University of Hartford (not necessarily the same person).

name: Hussman, Walter E. Jr.
title: Chairman (retired as Publisher of Arkansas Democrat-Gazette, January 2023)
donations: Known for advocating journalism standards; WEHCO Media is privately held (no SEC filings)
ngos: Board of Directors, The Associated Press (2000-2009); Board, C-SPAN (1995-2003); Arkansas Arts Center board; Arkansas Repertory Theater board; Arkansas Symphony Orchestra Society board; Chairman, P.A.R.K. Foundation; President, Donaghey Foundation; Winrock International
notes: Walter E. Hussman Jr. (born January 5, 1947) is a third-generation Arkansas newspaper publisher who built the Arkansas Democrat-Gazette into the state's largest newspaper through a famous 1980s newspaper war. He retired as publisher in January 2023 after 48 years and donated $20 million to name the Hussman School of Journalism at UNC-Chapel Hill.

name: Lindstrom, Gregory P.
title: Mediator/Arbitrator; formerly Partner, Latham & Watkins
notes: Gregory P. Lindstrom (born August 4, 1953, Hollywood) graduated from UCLA summa cum laude in 1975 and attended University of Chicago Law School. He spent 30 years at Latham & Watkins (partner 1986, Managing Partner of San Francisco office), specializing in complex litigation including antitrust and securities fraud. He was co-lead counsel in the landmark US v. Oracle (2004). He has been a full-time mediator and arbitrator since 2012.

name: MacDonnell, Miles C.
title: Owner and Co-COO
notes: Miles C. MacDonnell is the owner and Co-COO of Round Pond Estate, a 468-acre family winery in Rutherford, Napa Valley. He holds a psychology and economics degree from Southern Methodist University and an MBA from Boston College (2005). Before joining the family winery in 2001 he worked at Deloitte in Assurance & Advisory Services.

name: McLaughlin, Stuart
title: Partner
notes: Stuart 'Stu' McLaughlin (Williams College BA, History, 1994) began his career as a McKinsey analyst, then spent two years in venture capital before earning his Stanford MBA. He is a Partner at Sansome Partners, a small investment firm in San Francisco.

name: O'Leary, William F.
title: Unknown

name: Parsons, Travis M.

name: Precourt, Jay Anthony Jr.
title: Founder, Majority Owner and CEO (Austin FC)
notes: Jay Anthony Precourt Jr. (also known as Anthony Precourt) is the son of late oil executive Jay A. Precourt (1937-2024). He holds a BA from Pepperdine and an MBA from Dartmouth Tuck. He founded Precourt Capital Management in 2008, then created Precourt Sports Ventures in 2012, owning the Columbus Crew before founding Austin FC (the 27th MLS franchise) in 2019.

name: Reynolds, Robert Joseph
title: Unknown

name: Spieker, Warren 'Ned' E. Jr.
employer: Spieker Realty Investments; Continuing Life (CCRC developer)

ngos: UC Berkeley Foundation Trustee; Haas School of Business Advisory Board; Urban Land Institute (ULI) past Board of Trustees
notes: Warren 'Ned' Spieker Jr. founded Spieker Properties in 1987 and took it public as a REIT in 1993, growing it into the largest REIT in the Western U.S. (42 million sq ft). He sold Spieker Properties to Sam Zell's Equity Office Properties Trust in 2001 for over $7 billion. He is a Haas School alumnus who donated $30 million to UC Berkeley Haas and $26 million to Cal Men's Aquatics.

name: Ullyot, Theodore Warren
title: Executive Vice President and General Counsel
donations: Known Republican-affiliated; worked in Bush White House; co-founded Torridon Law with former AG William Barr
ngos: Co-Chairman, Federalist Society Board of Visitors; George W. Bush Presidential Center (advisory roles)
notes: Ted Ullyot (Harvard BA magna cum laude 1990; University of Chicago Law JD 1994) clerked for Justice Antonin Scalia and served as Associate Counsel in the Bush White House and Chief of Staff to Attorney General Gonzales. He was Facebook's General Counsel (2008-2013), then joined Andreessen Horowitz, co-founded Torridon Law with former AG William Barr, and became NFL's top lawyer in 2023.

name: Anderson, Bruce Garrett
title: Unknown

name: Cartan, Jim
title: Regional Vice President
notes: Jim Cartan is an experienced Regional Vice President with a demonstrated history working in media circulation, associated with KCG Ventures dba Dominion Distribution. He attended San Diego State University and is based in the Greater Sacramento area.

name: Fraughton, Edward J.
title: Sculptor / Artist
notes: Edward James Fraughton (March 22, 1939 - June 2, 2024) was an award-winning American sculptor known for monumental bronze works depicting the American West and LDS subjects. He died of a rare blood cancer in South Jordan, Utah at age 85. He received a Lifetime Achievement Award from the National Portrait Society of America in April 2024.

name: Fuery, Charles P.
title: Unknown

name: Glaser, Will
title: Founder / CEO
notes: Will Glaser co-founded Pandora (originally Savage Beast Technologies) in 2000 and served as its CTO and COO. He holds a triple major from Cornell University in Computer Science, Mathematics, and Physics. He later founded Grabango, a checkout-free shopping technology company, which ceased operations in 2024. As of 2025 his LinkedIn indicates he is at Ascendiun.

name: Green, J. Jeffrey
title: Owner / Principal
donations: Active lobbyist; lobbied for 32 clients in 2019
notes: Jeffery A. Green founded J.A. Green & Company in 2007, a full-service bipartisan government relations firm near Capitol Hill. He has over 16 years of experience with the Department of Defense and on Capitol Hill, including as Staff Director to the House Armed Services Subcommittee on Readiness. He holds a Masters of Law in Government Procurement and a J.D.

name: Grogan, Thomas J. Jr.
employer: Pacific Coast Sports Medicine / West Hills Hospital
title: Orthopedic Surgeon
notes: Dr. Thomas J. Grogan Jr. is an orthopedic surgeon with 37 years of experience specializing in Sports Medicine and Pediatric Orthopedic Surgery. He earned his B.S. in Biology from Princeton University and his M.D. from the University of Cincinnati College of Medicine (1980). He is affiliated with West Hills Hospital and Providence Saint John's Health Center in Los Angeles.

name: Holt, Peter M.
employer: HoltCat (retired) / San Antonio Spurs (former principal owner)
title: Former CEO / Former Principal Owner
notes: Peter M. Holt (born July 26, 1948) is a decorated Vietnam veteran (Silver Star, three Bronze Stars for Valor, Purple Heart) and former CEO of HoltCat, the largest Caterpillar dealership in the United States. He became principal owner of the San Antonio Spurs in 1993; during his tenure the team won five NBA championships. He stepped down as chairman in 2016 and transferred HoltCat to his son Peter J. Holt.

title: President & CEO / Founder

notes: Victor L. Hymes founded Legato Capital Management in 2004, an investment management firm that seeds and develops entrepreneurial investment teams. He is a graduate of the Oberlin Conservatory of Music with an MBA from Stanford Graduate School of Business. He previously worked at Goldman Sachs, Kidder Peabody, and Scudder Stevens & Clark.

name: Johnson, Gregory K.
title: President / CEO
notes: Gregory K. Johnson is President of Wright Runstad & Company, a Seattle-based commercial real estate development firm. He was named Seattle region Executive of the Year by the Puget Sound Business Journal in 2014. He holds a B.S. in Civil Engineering from Bucknell University and an MBA in Real Estate from the Wharton School.

name: Jones, Proctor Patterson Jr.
title: Photographer / Tour Guide
notes: Proctor Patterson Jones Jr. (July 17, 1952 - April 9, 2025) was the son of San Francisco attorney and author Proctor P. Jones Sr. He was a photographer who collaborated with his father on travel books including 'Dawn of Glasnost,' which was presented by President Reagan to Gorbachev. He was a guide at Mr. Toad's Tours in San Francisco, conducting tours in a Model A Ford, and was a longtime San Francisco resident.

name: Mancini, Jay C.
title: Executive Coach / Chair
notes: Jay C. Mancini is a Wharton School MBA and former Marine Corps infantry officer who spent time with special operations units. He previously led real estate development projects including Menlo Gateway in Menlo Park, CA. He transitioned to executive coaching with Vistage Worldwide.

name: Marston, Michael
title: Unknown

name: McMaster, Herbert R.
title: Fouad and Michelle Ajami Senior Fellow
ngos: Chairman, Board of Advisors, Center on Military and Political Power, Foundation for Defense of Democracies; Member, Global Advisory Council, McCain Institute
notes: Lieutenant General H.R. McMaster (born July 24, 1962) is a retired U.S. Army general who served as the 25th National Security Advisor to President Trump (2017-2018). He holds a Ph.D. in history from the University of North Carolina and authored 'Dereliction of Duty.' He is currently a Senior Fellow at the Hoover Institution and a lecturer at Stanford Graduate School of Business.

name: Montgomery, George F. II
title: Shareholder / Partner
notes: George F. Montgomery II is a San Francisco estate planning attorney who has practiced exclusively in estate planning, tax, and trust administration since 1982. He is a fifth-generation Californian, a Stanford undergraduate (1978), and a graduate of UC Hastings College of the Law (1982, Order of the Coif). He is a Certified Specialist in Estate Planning, Trust and Probate Law.

name: Mullen, Michael G.

He is a graduate of the U.S. Naval Academy and holds an M.S. from the Naval Postgraduate School.

After retiring from the Marine Corps in 1995 he worked for Bechtel Corporation on the Korean high-speed rail project. He served as President and CEO of the Marines' Memorial Association in San Francisco from 2001 until retiring from that role in 2017.
